name: HTML Questions
description: Test your knowledge of HTML markup and structure

easy.question:
What will this HTML code render? ```html

Welcome

Hello World!

  • Item 1
  • Item 2
```
easy.explanation: The <h2> renders as normal heading, <strong> makes text bold (not caps), and <ul> creates bullet points (not numbers).

easy.question:
What will this HTML form render?

```html
<form>
  <label for='email'>Email:</label>
  <input type='email' id='email' required>
  <input type='submit' value='Send'>
</form>
```
answers: <label>Email:</label> <input type='text' style='border:1px solid #ccc; padding:2px'> <input type='submit' value='Send' style='padding:2px 8px'>
<label>Email:</label> <input type='email' required style='border:1px solid #ccc; padding:2px'> <input type='submit' value='Send' style='padding:2px 8px'>
<input type='email' required style='border:1px solid #ccc; padding:2px'> <input type='submit' value='Send' style='padding:2px 8px'>
easy.explanation: The label creates 'Email:' text, type='email' creates a validated email field, and type='submit' creates a Send button.

easy.question:
How will this table render? ```html
Name Age
John 25
```
easy.explanation: <th> creates header cells (bold by default), <td> creates data cells, and border='1' adds table borders.

easy.question:

```
answers: HOME | ABOUT
easy.explanation: displays the actual image at 100px width, while tags create clickable links. Alt text only shows if image fails to load.

hard.question:
What will this code structure render?

```html
<dl>
  <dt>HTML</dt>
  <dd>Markup Language</dd>
  <dt>CSS</dt>
  <dd>Style Sheets</dd>
</dl>
```
answers: <dl><dt style='font-weight:bold'>HTML</dt><dd style='margin-left:20px'>Markup Language</dd><dt style='font-weight:bold'>CSS</dt><dd style='margin-left:20px'>Style Sheets</dd></dl>
hard.explanation: <dl> creates a description list, <dt> are terms (bold), and <dd> are descriptions (indented).
